definitions.definition: To call out; to draw out or bring forth.
To cause the manifestation of something (emotion, picture, etc.) in someone's mind or imagination.
definitions.example: Being here evokes long forgotten memories.

definitions.definition: To elicit a response.
The state of being punctual
To activate again.
Of or pertaining to an acrobat.
Vigorously active
Having a dry, harsh tone to the voice, as a result of a sore throat, age, emotion, etc.
The act of detecting or sensing something; discovering something that was hidden or disguised.
The finding out of a constituent, a signal, an agent or the like, mostly by means of a specific device or method.
Bad luck
definitions.example: It was my fortune, or misfortune, to be called to the office of Chief Executive without any previous political training. - Ulysses S. Grant

definitions.definition: An undesirable event such as an accident
definitions.example: She had to come to terms with a number of misfortunes.

definitions.definition: To trouble aggressively, to harass.
To annoy, irritate.
To cause (mental) suffering to; to distress.
To twist, to weave.
To be irritated; to fret.
To toss back and forth; to agitate; to disquiet.
Annoyed, irritated or distressed
definitions.example: She became more and more vexed as she struggled to cope with the demands of the job.

definitions.definition: Much debated, discussed or disputed
The act of detaining or the state of being detained.
A temporary state of custody or confinement, especially of a prisoner awaiting trial, or of a student being punished.
The bare physical control without the mental element of intention required for possession.
The technology of the conversion of sunlight into electricity using semiconductors that exhibit the photovoltaic effect.
To form a complex with another substance
To complicate.
Combined in the form of a complex
Complex, complicated
One of a family of dishes originating from South Asian cuisine, flavoured by a spiced sauce.
A spiced sauce or relish, especially one flavoured with curry powder.
Curry powder.
A site for mining stone, limestone, or slate.
definitions.example: Michelangelo personally quarried marble from the world-famous quarry at Carrara.

definitions.definition: A part of the entrails of a hunted animal, given to the hounds as a reward.
An animal, often a bird or mammal, which is hunted.
An object of search or pursuit.
A diamond-shaped tile or pane, often of glass or stone.
To cook or season with curry powder.
To groom (a horse); to dress or rub down a horse with a curry comb.
To dress (leather) after it is tanned by beating, rubbing, scraping and colouring.
To beat, thrash; to drub.
To try to win or gain (favour) by flattering.
To perform currying upon.
To scurry; to ride or run hastily
To cover (a distance); (of a projectile) to traverse (its range).
To hurry.
A book or listing that contains a collection of readings for Christian worship.
Government by bureaus or their administrators or officers.

(organizational theory) A system of administration based upon organisation into bureaus, division of labour, a hierarchy of authority, etc., designed to dispose of a large body of work in a routine manner.
definitions.example: At that time the administration replaced the system of patronage in the civil service with a bureaucracy.

definitions.definition: The body of officers and administrators, especially of a government.
definitions.example: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy. (apocryphal quip)

definitions.definition: Excessive red tape and routine in any administration, body or behaviour.
definitions.example: The head of the civil service promised to clamp down on bureaucracy.

definitions.definition: Having the shape of a column.
Constructed with columns.
A small, exclusive group of individuals, usually according to lifestyle or social status; a cabal.
definitions.example: This school used to be really friendly, but now everyone keeps to their own cliques.

definitions.definition: A subgraph isomorphic to a complete graph.
definitions.example: The problem of finding the largest clique in an arbitrary graph is NP-complete.

definitions.definition: A group of related web sites that link to each other, like a webring but with exclusive membership determined by the clique owner.
One trillion (1012, or 1,000,000,000,000) bytes. SI symbol: TB.
Imprecisely, a tebibyte or 10244 (1,099,511,627,776) bytes. SI symbol: TiB, computing symbol: TB.
To dig the ground, especially with a shovel.
To search thoroughly and carefully for information, research, dig into, penetrate, fathom, trace out
To dig, to excavate.
The act of one who delves.
The shaking of tin ore in a sieve held underwater so that the waste flows out, leaving the tin behind.
To defeat, to overcome.
Defeated.
A type of hammer with a larger-than-usual head made of wood, rubber or similar non-iron material, used by woodworkers for driving a tool, such as a chisel. A kind of maul.
definitions.example: Carpenters use mallets for assembling.

definitions.definition: A weapon resembling the tool, but typically much larger.
A small hammer-like tool used for playing certain musical instruments.
A light beetle with a long handle used in playing croquet.
The stick used to strike the ball in the sport of polo.
A breed of beef cattle.
(entertainment) To have top billing; to be the main attraction.
An instrument for measuring atmospheric pressure.
(by extension) Anything used as a gauge or indicator.
To make use of; to use.
To make useful; to find a practical use for.
To make best use of; to use to its fullest extent, potential, or ability.
To make do with; to use in manner different from that originally intended
A person who inquires, especially searchingly or ruthlessly.
An official of the ecclesiastical court of the Inquisition.
To cover or furnish with a floor.
definitions.example: floor a house with pine boards

definitions.definition: To strike down or lay level with the floor; to knock down.
(driving) To accelerate rapidly.
definitions.example: As soon as our driver saw an insurgent in a car holding a detonation device, he floored the pedal and was 2,000 feet away when that car bomb exploded. We escaped certain death in the nick of time!

definitions.definition: To silence by a conclusive answer or retort.
definitions.example: Floored or crushed by him. — Coleridge

definitions.definition: To amaze or greatly surprise.
definitions.example: We were floored by his confession.

definitions.definition: To finish or make an end of.
definitions.example: I've floored my little-go work — ed Hughes

definitions.definition: To set a lower bound.
To take possession of as a right (especially in Biblical translations).
definitions.example: Your descendants will inherit the earth.

definitions.definition: To receive (property, a title, etc.), by legal succession or bequest after the previous owner's death.
definitions.example: After Grandad died, I inherited the house.

definitions.definition: To receive a characteristic from one's ancestors by genetic transmission.
definitions.example: Let's hope the baby inherits his mother's looks and his father's intelligence.

definitions.definition: To derive from people or conditions previously in force.
definitions.example: This country has inherited an invidious class culture.

definitions.definition: To come into an inheritance.
definitions.example: Lucky old Daniel – his grandfather died rich, and he's inherited.

definitions.definition: To derive (existing functionality) from a superclass.
definitions.example: ModalWindow inherits all the properties and methods of Window.

definitions.definition: To derive a new class from (a superclass).
To put in possession of.
To argue for a better deal, especially over prices with a seller.
definitions.example: I haggled for a better price because the original price was too high.

definitions.definition: To hack (cut crudely)
To stick at small matters; to chaffer; to higgle.
To bend; to fold; to mould; to adapt, to modify; to change (a person's) mind, to cause (a person) to submit.
To bend, to flex; to be bent by something, to give way or yield (to a force, etc.).
To work at (something) diligently.
definitions.example: He plied his trade as carpenter for forty-three years.

definitions.definition: To wield or use (a tool, a weapon, etc.) steadily or vigorously.
definitions.example: He plied his ax with bloody results.

definitions.definition: To press upon; to urge persistently.
definitions.example: to ply someone with questions or solicitations

definitions.definition: To persist in offering something to, especially for the purpose of inducement or persuasion.
definitions.example: to ply someone with drink

definitions.definition: To travel over (a route) regularly.
definitions.example: The steamer plies between several ports on the coast.

definitions.definition: To work diligently.
To manoeuvre a sailing vessel so that the direction of the wind changes from one side of the vessel to the other; to work to windward, to beat, to tack.
The medial line (or plane) of the body, which divides the body into halves that are mirror-images of each other.
The level of the top of the x-height of a typeface.
Someone or something that beats.
A kitchen implement for mixing.
A stick used to play a percussion instrument.
A person who drives game towards shooters in a hunting party, often working in a group.
A papermaking machine for processing fibres by fibrillation in order to improve bonding strength
An automobile in poor operating condition.
A weaving tool designed to push the weft yarn securely into place. It contains the comb-like insert reed and is sometimes a part of the loom.
A harp seal pup after its first moult and before its second moult.
A sleeveless undershirt.
One who or that which helps something to happen.
One who encourages a bad habit in another (typically drug addiction) by their behaviour.
One who gives someone else the power to behave in a certain way.
The sharp, quick sound of a vibrating tight string, for example, of a bow or a musical instrument.
A particular sharp vibrating sound characteristic of electric guitars.
A trace of a regional or foreign accent in someone's voice.
definitions.example: Despite having lived in Canada for 20 years, he still has that Eastern-European twang in his voice.

definitions.definition: The sound quality that appears in the human voice when the epilaryngeal tube is narrowed.
A sharp, disagreeable taste or flavor.
To produce or cause to produce a sharp vibrating sound, like a tense string pulled and suddenly let go.
To have a nasal sound.
To have a trace of a regional or foreign accent.
To play a stringed musical instrument by plucking and snapping.
A nocturnal omnivore native to North America, typically with a mixture of gray, brown, and black fur, a mask-like marking around the eyes and a striped tail; Procyon lotor.
Any mammal of the genus Procyon.
Any mammal of the subfamily Procyoninae, a procyonine.
Any mammal of the family Procyonidae, a procyonid.
Not correlated
Having a covariance of zero
To collapse or burst inward violently.
To compress (data) with a particular algorithm.
A large Mediterranean food fish Umbrina cirrosa
(colors) A gradual blending of one color hue to another, usually moving tints and shades from light to dark.
To develop an idea; to form in the mind; to plan; to devise; to originate.
To understand (someone).
To become pregnant (with).
definitions.example: Assisted procreation can help those trying to conceive.

definitions.definition: Conception.
That which cannot be divided or split.
An infinitely small quantity which is assumed to admit of no further division.
Incapable of being divided; atomic.
Incapable of being divided by a specific integer without leaving a remainder.
Of or pertaining to sound; of the nature of sound; acoustic.
Relating to poetry.
definitions.example: Iambics are one form of poetic meter.

definitions.definition: Characteristic of poets; romantic, imaginative, etc.
Connecting to the soul of the beholder.
A female prostitute who is hired by telephone.
(Cebu) A woman who works as a call center agent. (see usage notes)
An unsteady movement of the body in walking or standing as if one were about to fall; a reeling motion
definitions.example: the stagger of a drunken man

definitions.definition: A disease of horses and other animals, attended by reeling, unsteady gait or sudden falling
definitions.example: apoplectic or sleepy staggers

definitions.definition: Bewilderment; perplexity.
The spacing out of various actions over time.
The difference in circumference between the left and right tires on a racing vehicle. It is used on oval tracks to make the car turn better in the corners.
The horizontal positioning of a biplane, triplane, or multiplane's wings in relation to one another.
Sway unsteadily, reel, or totter.
Doubt, waver, be shocked.
Have multiple groups doing the same thing in a uniform fashion, but starting at different, evenly-spaced, times or places (attested from 1856).
To cover with a crust.
To form a crust.
A framework of steel bars resting on side supports to bridge over or around something.
A supporting framework for a barrel.
A gantry crane or gantry scaffold.
(medical imaging) A cylindrical scanner assembly in the bore of which the response of bodies or tissues to some specific exposure can be detected for 3D imaging.
To regulate, adjust or adapt
To change the pitch, intensity or tone of one's voice or of a musical instrument
To vary the amplitude, frequency or phase of a carrier wave in proportion to the amplitude etc of a source wave (such as speech or music)
To move from one key or tonality to another, especially by using a chord progression
Of, or relating to heraldry or heralds.
A plant related to the thistle with enlarged flower heads eaten as a vegetable while immature, Cynara cardunculus var. scolymus.
A dull green colour, like that of an artichoke.
Any ailment or disease of the body; especially, a lingering or deep-seated disorder.
A moral or mental defect or disorder.
To declare to be.
To deem or determine to be.
To award judicially; to assign.
